column5: headin up to my friends cottage for the weekend.......he sits right across from the shawanaga river  was wondering if anyone has some insights with this area....  any help would be greatly appreciated   thxs pete
Lots of Nothern Pike in the area.. if your fishing, a fluorocarbon or wire leader is a good thing..
hopefully, your friend knows where all the rocks are.
Stop in at the tackle shop on #69.  The proprietor also owns  a small lodge on the bay. He is always very helpful. Like said before, lots of pike, but don't overlook the bass.
Awesome SmallMouth - Find the sunken Sailboat - enough said!

What are you fishing for ? fish still haven't moved into the river not cold enough. And yes watch out for unmarked rocks all over the bay. Big smallies are hitting on shallow rock. Worms or minnows are working.
